data: OB Magnesium Sulfate Administration for Seizure Prevention (Module)
Ensure that OB Gestational Hypertension and Pre-Eclampsia Intrapartum (Module) is completed. Continue magnesium sulfate administration following delivery and reconcile orders into postpartum
q5min during magnesium sulfate loading dose
q1h during magnesium sulfate maintenance infusion
Continuous on mother during magnesium sulfate loading dose, then q1h
q4h for patient on magnesium sulfate infusion; notify provider if level of consciousness decreases
q4h, assess biceps or patellar reflexes, muscle tone and strength during magnesium sulfate maintenance infusion
q1h, during magnesium sulfate maintenance dose infusion
Indwelling, and attach to urometer bag
For seizure prevention consider total infusion rate of 80 mL/h
order rate: 55 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
4 g, IV, once, administer over: 30 minute
magnesium sulfate continuous infusion (40 mg/mL) in NS standard
magnesium sulfate continuous infusion (40 mg/mL) in NS standard
1 g, IV, once, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
